data.title: Oil prices drop as rising U.S. coronavirus cases stoke fears of weak fuel demand
data.text: Oil prices fell on Monday, with U.S. oil dropping more than 2%, as a spike in new coronavirus cases in the United States raised concerns over a second wave of the virus which would weigh on the pace of fuel demand recovery.

data.title: India shut down its economy to contain the coronavirus. It's now one of the most affected countries
data.text: India trails behind the U.S., Brazil and Russia, with cumulative infection numbers over 320,000, according to Johns Hopkins University data.

data.title: Systemic racism slows economic growth: Dallas Fed chief Kaplan
data.text: Systemic racism and high unemployment levels among black and Hispanic Americans create a drag on the U.S. economy, Dallas Federal Reserve President Robert Kaplan said on Sunday.

data.title: Optimize Community QE - An Open Letter To Fed Chairman Powell
data.text: The Fed's new Municipal Liquidity Facility aims to provide federal funding to de facto federal instrumentalities - the States and Cities at the front lines of our national pandemic response. Fees must accordingly be dropped, eligibility must be broadened, and administration must be decentralized.

data.title: Pro traders scramble for protection in 'warp speed' market, spur quadrupling of S&P 500 hedge cost
data.text: As fears of a drastic pullback intensified, it has gotten four times more expensive to hedge against more losses in the S&P 500 than before the coronavirus landed.
